history.content:
On April 28 from 3 to 6 PM PST, Quantum Computing at Berkeley is hosting Quantum Computing Triple Play, a NO-COST 3 HOUR MINI-CONFERENCE (onsite and online).

In-person attendance is limited! RSVP now before space runs out!

RSVP NOW for a fun & informative event with 3 sessions!

  • Learning For Beginners (3:00-4:00)
  • Industry Insights (4:00-5:30)
  • Reception & Networking (refreshment + food) (5:30-6:00)

This event is open to all people with an interest in quantum computing, regardless of experience. Indeed, to help you get up to speed, you’ll receive links to two free highly-informative Quantum Computing books when you RSVP.

WHY THIS EVENT DESERVES YOUR ATTENTION
By attending you’ll learn from from two industry leaders

  • Dr. Terry Rudolph (Co-founder of PsiQuantum, Schrodinger's Grandson) about an intuitive understanding Quantum Computing as well as PsiQuantum's photonic approach
  • Denise Ruffner (Atom Computing, Founder of the Women in Quantum initiative) on quantum hardware research and Atom Computing's neutral atom approach

TWO BONUS REASONS TO RSVP

Receive a link to download educational materials

  • Q Is For Quantum – by Dr. Terry Rudolph – advocates a diagrammatic approach to teaching Quantum Computing using high school math.
  • The Quantum Decade – by IBM, is a beautifully executed coffee-table quality playbook for achieving quantum awareness, readiness and advantage, all presented with informative and digestible content.
    RSVP NOW & NEVER MISS OUT!
history.subject: Wanna Meet Schrodinger's Grandson?
